greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: a(1)=1; starting with n>1, concatenate distinct divisors which are in A050376 in increasing order and repeat until a term of A050376 is reached (a(n)=0 if no term of A050376 is ever reached).
comment: Fermi-Dirac analog of A037274 (terms of A050376 are Fermi-Dirac primes).
link: Hiroaki Yamanouchi, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..100
results.author: _Vladimir Shevelev_, Oct 12 2014
ext: a(8) and a(34) corrected by _Hiroaki Yamanouchi_, Oct 13 2014
